height: 140px;" alt="" src="/resources/Pictures/Prison-Guard.jpg" height="374" border="0" width="560"><br></div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center">&nbsp;</div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center">Our monthly Newsletter provides information about activities, upcoming events, and resources to connect the psychology-law community.</div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center"><br>&nbsp;</div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center">AP-LS aspires to excel as a valuable, effective, and influential organization advancing the science of psychology-law and the translation of psychology-law knowledge into practice and policy. &nbsp;</div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center">&nbsp;</div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center"><br></div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center"></div><div style="line-height: 20px;" align="center"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr><td style="line-height: 1px;" align="left" valign="top"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr><td style="line-height: 1px; padding: 14px 11px 10px 8px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell2" valign="top"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell2" data-innereditablearea="cell2" style=""><p style="line-height: 22px;" align="left"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>PSYCHOLOGY LAW EVIDENCE DATABASE</strong></font></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">It is becoming increasingly challenging for professionals and the public to navigate through the ever-growing body of information to identify and access high-quality research that is relevant to their respective fields. The Psychology Law Evidence Database (PLED) was created to address this need.</font><font style="font-size: 20px;"><br></font></p><p><font style="font-size: 20px;"><font style="font-size: 16px;">For more information click <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/October2017/PLEDAdvertisement.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font><br></font></p><p>To access the PLED, please visit <a href="http://www.psychologylawevidence.com">www.psychologylawevidence.com</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Any individuals interested in serving as expert reviewers are encouraged to contact <a href="mailto:PLED@sfu.ca">PLED@sfu.ca</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font><strong><strong><font style="font-size: 24px;">REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS</font></strong></strong></font><br></p><p><u><font style="font-size: 20px;">$3,000 APF Trauma Psychology Grant</font></u></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">The American Psychological Foundation’s (APF) 2018 Trauma Psychology Grant seeks to support innovative work to alleviate trauma.</font></p><p>See our website for more information <a href="http://www.apa.org/apf/funding/trauma-psychology-grant.aspx">http://www.apa.org/apf/funding/trauma-psychology-grant.aspx</a></p><p>The deadline for applications is&nbsp;<strong>February 15, 2018</strong>.</p><p><font style="font-size: 24px;"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>LEGAL UPDATE</strong></font></p><p><span lang="EN-US">In this issue’s Legal Update column, featuring a new editor, a freely available mental health law news resource is profiled. A short primer on legal research is also provided for readers without formal legal training. Click <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/October2017/legalupdate.pdf" target="_blank">here</a> to view the Legal Update.</span></p><font style="font-size: 16px;"><p><br></p></font><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW: ADVANCES IN PSYCHOLOGY</strong></font></p><p><span lang="EN-US"><font style="font-size: 16px;">This is a quarterly review and summary of the valuable advancements in the psychological and legal fields. Sometimes staying on top of all the news, research and legal updates relevant to the field can be a daunting task. Our hope with this quarterly update is to save you some time and keep you informed! Click <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/October2017/WhatyouShouldKnow1017.pdf" target="_blank">here</a> to learn about the advances in psychology.</font></span></p><p><span lang="EN-US"><br></span></p><span lang="EN-US"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font style="font-size: 24px;">RESEARCH BRIEFS</font></strong></p><p><span style="color:black">Take a look at the latest research briefs for short summaries of the latest articles relevant to psychology-law.</span></p><p><span style="color:black">Cl<font>ick <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/October2017/ResearchBriefs1017.pdf" target="_blank">here</a> to see the latest briefs.</font></span></p><p><span style="color:black"><br></span></p><p><span 0%; padding: 14px 7px 0px 8px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell3" valign="top"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell3" data-innereditablearea="cell3" style=""><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>PRESIDENTIAL INITIATIVE: DOING GOOD IN MEMPHIS</strong></font></p><p align="center"><strong><font size="5"><img title="" alt="" src="/resources/Pictures/ebrank.jpg" height="238" border="0" width="158"></font></strong><br></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">One of Eve Brank's presidential initiatives is to "do good" in the communities in which we have AP-LS conferences. The External-Focused Presidential Task Force has developed a few options for the upcoming conference in Memphis and they would like to hear whether you are interested in being involved in this outreach. We have brainstormed a few ideas including doing presentations or trainings with local attorneys, correctional facility employees, social workers, and students in high schools, community colleges, or universities.</font></p><p>For those of you who have or who will submit a proposal for the AP-LS conference, the submission portal provides an opportunity to express interest in participating in this externally focused initiative. If you are not planning on submitting a proposal for AP-LS and you would still like to know more about this initiative, then please follow this link <a href="http://goo.gl/o8fZBc" target="_blank">http://goo.gl/o8fZBc</a> where you can indicate your interest. Please do so by October 6th. More details will be provided soon!</p><p><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong><em><br></em></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>AP-LS STUDENT COMMITTEE: CAREER CORNER</strong></font></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">The Career Corner is intended to highlight the individuals who work at the intersection of law and psychology, where they come from, how they got there and how their experiences influence their research, teaching, and/or practice. This edition of Career Corner profiles Eve M. Brank, J.D., Ph.D, the 2017-2018 President of the APA Division 41 American Psychology-Law Society.&nbsp;</font></p><p>Click <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/October2017/APLSStudentCommitteeCareerCornerEveBrank.pdf" target="_blank">here</a> to view this edition of Career Corner.</p><p><br></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>COLLABORATIVE APA SYMPOSIUM</strong></font></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">The Human Animal Interactions (HAI) section of Division 17 (Counseling Psychology) is working with Divisions 20 and 54 on creating a collaborative symposium on the topic of emotional support dogs and service dogs. As there are many legal issues associated with this, Division 41 would be a natural collaborator in this effort. For more information or if you wish to collaborate, please contact Lori Kogan at <a href="mailto:Lori.Kogan@ColoState.edu">Lori.Kogan@ColoState.edu</a>.&nbsp;</font></p><p><br></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>AP-LS CONTACTS<br></strong></font></p><p>Email addresses for all current EC members and Committe Chairs&nbsp; can be found <a href="/resources/Documents/ENews/ECcommittee2017-2018.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.<strong><font style="font-size: 24px;"><em><br></em></font></strong></p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td><td class="cellContainer cell4Container" align="" width="200" valign="top">									<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" width="100%">										<tbody><tr>											<td class="cellOuter" style="padding: 0px;" data-cellouter="cell4" valign="top">												<table data-cellborder="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" width="100%">													<tbody><tr>														<td class="cellInner" style="background-position: 0% 0%; padding: 14px 8px 0px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell4" valign="top"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell4" data-innereditablearea="cell4" style=""><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><strong>2016 DISSERTATION AWARD WINNERS</strong></font></p><p><font style="font-size: 16px;">Dr. Evan McCuish is our 1st place dissertation award winner. His dissertation, entitled "Bringing Psychopathy into Research on Offending Trajectories: Understanding the Construct's Role as a Barrier to Desistance", investigated the trajectories of chronic, serious, and violent offending of incarcerated males and females between the ages of 12 and 28. Evan completed his dissertation at Simon Fraser University under the supervision of Dr. Raymond R. Corrado.</font><br></p><p>Dr. Caitlin Cavanagh is our 2nd place dissertation award winner. Her dissertation, entitled "Parental Guidance: The Role of Family in Youth Reoffending", examined the reciprocal effects of justice system contact on the parent-child dyad by interviewing almost 300 mothers and their sons who were first-time offenders over the course of 2.5 years. Caitlin completed her dissertation at the University of California, Irvine, under the supervision of Dr. Elizabeth Cauffman.&nbsp;</p><p>Dr. Kelsey S. Henderson is our 3rd place dissertation award winner. Her dissertation, entitled "Investigating Predictors of True and False Guilty Pleas", focused on plea decision making in an analogue context by examining whether guilty and innocent students accused of cheating plead guilty or took their case before the Student Conduct Committee. Kelsey completed her dissertation at the University of Florida under the supervision of Dr. Lora M. Levett.<br></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><span style="color:black"><br></span></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><span style="color:black"><strong><font style="font-size: 24px;">EARLY CAREER PROFESSIONALS COMMITTEE</font></strong></span><span style="color:black"><strong><br></strong></span></p><p><span class="m_-2930113907296057392gmail-author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90z9z84zhz73zgcz68zxz65zytz67zz69znz78zz77zz83zz73zz79z8mz122zz81zoz71zz68z7z90zz74zbh">The AP-LS Early Career Professionals Committee is hosting a free, drop-in statistics consultation table at the 2018 conference in Memphis</span> <span class="m_-2930113907296057392gmail-author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90z9z84zhz73zgcz68zxz65zytz67zz69znz78zz77zz83zz73zz79z8mz122zz81zoz71zz68z7z90zz74zbh m_-2930113907296057392gmail-h-lparen">(</span><span class="m_-2930113907296057392gmail-author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90z9z84zhz73zgcz68zxz65zytz67zz69znz78zz77zz83zz73zz79z8mz122zz81zoz71zz68z7z90zz74zbh">March 8-10). We are currently seeking volunteers to help cover the desk. Volunteers will be asked to select at least one hour that works best for them. To be a volunteer consultant, one does not have to be a statistician, only proficient in the computation and/or interpretation of statistics.&nbsp; For this reason, it will be made clear to consultation table users that the expectation for service should not be comparable to the expectations placed on a paid statistical consultant.&nbsp; Last, you do not need to be an early career psychologist to volunteer.&nbsp; </span></p><p><span class="m_-2930113907296057392gmail-author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90z9z84zhz73zgcz68zxz65zytz67zz69znz78zz77zz83zz73zz79z8mz122zz81zoz71zz68z7z90zz74zbh">If you are interested in volunteering, please email James Andretta at <a href="mailto:jamesrandretta@gmail.com">jamesrandretta@gmail.com</a>, and provide him with your full name, your institution, 3 to 4 areas of statistical competence/expertise, and the statistical software package(s) that you are most familiar with using.</span></p><p><span class="m_-2930113907296057392gmail-author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90z9z84zhz73zgcz68zxz65zytz67zz69znz78zz77zz83zz73zz79z8mz122zz81zoz71zz68z7z90zz74zbh">After the release of the AP-LS 2018 conference schedule, James will provide all volunteers with access to an e-calendar to sign up for a specific day and time to help cover the desk for one hour.</span><strong></strong><em></em><sub></sub><sup></sup><br></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong></strong><em></em><sub></sub><sup></sup><br></p><p align="center"><br></p></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td>							</tr>						</tbody></table><table class="row" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" width="100%">							<tbody><tr>								<td class="cellContainer cell5Container" align="" width="600" valign="top">									<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" width="100%">										<tbody><tr>											<td class="cellOuter" style="padding: 0px;" data-cellouter="cell5" valign="top">												<table data-cellborder="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" width="100%">													<tbody><tr>														<td class="cellInner" style="background-position: 0% 0%;
